title: Hanwha registers as South Korean satellite communications provider
summary: South Korea’s Hanwha Systems, the OneWeb investor with plans for its own low Earth orbit (LEO) broadband constellation, has secured regulatory permission to operate as a satellite communications provider in the country.

title: ViaSat-3 Americas’  antenna problem impacts rollout
summary: The problem with ViaSat-3 Americas' main antenna does not affect current services provided by Viasat but does impact plans for new broadband services in North America that the spacecraft would have offered.

title: HawkEye 360 announces $58 million funding round
summary: HawkEye 360, a commercial operator of remote-sensing satellites, announced July 13 it has raised $58 million in new funding.

title: Rocket Lab takes another step towards reusability on next Electron launch
summary: Rocket Lab’s next Electron launch will feature upgrades to the rocket that bring the company a step closer to being able to reuse its first stage.

title: NASA cancels Janus asteroid smallsat mission
summary: NASA has canceled a mission to send a pair of smallsats to binary asteroids and will put the nearly completed spacecraft into storage for a potential future opportunity.

title: FCC Nominees Win Committee Approval
summary: The Senate Commerce, Science, and Transportation Committee approved the nominations of three FCC commissioners and the agency’s Inspector General today. The next stop is a confirmation vote by the full […]

title: Stunning Image Crowns JWST’s First Anniversary
summary: To celebrate the one-year anniversary of the first science-quality images from the James Webb Space Telescope, NASA and its JWST partners released a stunning image of a star-forming region 390 […]

title: Viasat stock plunges after company discloses malfunction in new satellite
summary: Viasat’s stock dropped in after-hours trading on Wednesday after the company disclosed its most recently launched communications satellite suffered a malfunction.

title: Viasat-3 Experiencing Potentially Fatal Deployment Issues
One year into science operations, Webb continues to rewrite the textbooks of science
summary: On July 12, 2022, five groups of scientists gathered in different agencies across the world to reveal the first five images taken by the historic NASA/European Space Agency/Canadian Space Agency James Webb Space Telescope. The release of the images officially marked the beginning of scientific operations on Webb, which is positioned 1.5 million kilometers away from Earth at the Sun-Earth Lagrange point two, or L2.
